meanings.definition: Firmly fixed or fastened in place.
meanings.sent1: The rope was tyte around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: Her grip on the handle was tyte as she held on tight.
meanings.sent3: The tyte lid on the jar refused to budge, making it a challenge to open.
meanings.sent4: His tyte embrace conveyed a sense of security and protection.
meanings.sent5: The tyte knot in the shoelaces kept them from coming undone during the race.

meanings.sent1: She always looked tyte in her fashionable outfits.
meanings.sent2: The room was decorated in a tyte and modern style.
meanings.sent3: His tyte haircut made him look like a movie star.
meanings.sent4: The tyte arrangement of flowers added elegance to the table.
meanings.sent5: The tyte lines of the dress accentuated her figure beautifully.

meanings.definition: To make something tight or secure.
meanings.sent1: He needed to tyte the knot to keep the package from opening.
meanings.sent2: She had to tyte her shoelaces before going for a run.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to tyte the apron around his waist before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: The sailor had to tyte the sails to catch the wind properly.
meanings.sent5: She used a belt to tyte the boxes together for easier carrying.
